summary:
This mod makes the Greybeard Robe, Hood and Boots playable. You can buy them from a few wizards around Skyrim. The Mage Armor perk works with these clothes.
There\'s is also a light armor variant, defeat a rogue Greybeard to get it.
descriptionHtml:
Japanese Translation Patch by aohige: [url=http://www.4shared.com/archive/vyfosew0/Playable_Greybeard_Robe_v15_.html]http://www.4shared.com/archive/vyfosew0/Playable_Greybeard_Robe_v15_.html[/url]


[size=4][color=lightblue]Playable Greybeard Robe v1.5 (by Volek)[/color][/size]

This mod makes the Greybeard Robe, Hood and Boots playable. 

The following versions are available:

* Greybeard Boots - Clothing, 1 lbs, enchantable
* Greybeard Hood - Clothing, 1 lbs, enchantable
* Greybeard Robe - Clothing, 5 lbs, enchantable
* Greybeard Boots (dragonborn) - Clothing, 1 lbs, 20% shout cooldown reduction
* Greybeard Hood (dragonborn) - Clothing, 1 lbs, 20% shout cooldown reduction
* Greybeard Robe (dragonborn) - Clothing, 5 lbs, 20% shout cooldown reduction
* Armored Greybeard Boots - Light Armor (2 DR), 2 lbs, enchantable
* Armored Greybeard Hood - Light Armor (2 DR), 2 lbs, enchantable
* Armored Greybeard Robe - Light Armor (8 DR), 7 lbs, enchantable

You can buy the clothing items from the following mages:

* Faralda in the College of Winterhold 
* Calcelmo in Markarth
* Farengar in Whiterun

You have to fight for the armored robes. The current owner is a rogue Greybeard who was last seen on his way to Eldersblood Peak.


[color=lightblue]Installation:[/color]

* Extract the content of the zip file to your Steam\\SteamApps\\common\\Skyrim\\ folder
* Locate the file C:\\Users\\{your user name}\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\\SkyrimPrefs.ini. Open it and search for the [Launcher] section. Add this line: \"bEnableFileSelection=1\" (without quotes). Then start the Skyrim launcher, the previously greyed out \"Data Files\" option is now available and you can select the plugin(s) that you wanna use from the list.

If you installed a previous version before, do the following, otherwise the merchant inventories may not update correctly:

* optional: sell the old items 
* deactivate and delete the old esp file
* load your savegame, ignore the warning message, and save your game.
* activate the new esp and load the game.


[color=lightblue]Version History:[/color]
1.5 - Mage Armor perk now works with unarmored robes
1.4 - fixed shout cooldown enchantment
1.3 - removed pre-enchanted robes, made more enchantments available, added armored version and NPC.
1.2 - added Dragonborn robes with 20% shout-cooldown (Blessing of Talos)
1.1 - added non-enchanted robes
1.0 - initial release


No permission needed to use this in other mods, just give credit.
author: Volek
